Metric.Name: Total number of classes
Metric.Description: Total number of classes in the design

Metric.Name: Number of total associations
Metric.Description: Number of total associations: the total number of associations within a class diagram

Metric.Name: Number of attributes
Metric.Description: Number of attributes of a class

Metric.Name: Number of local methods
Metric.Description: Number of local methods of a class. The inheritance methods are not taken into account

Metric.Name: The size of a class
Metric.Description: SIZE2 = NOA + NOM

Metric.Name: Average Parameters per Method
Metric.Description: Average Parameters per Method = TotalOfMethodsParameters/TotalNumberOfMethods

Metric.Name: Number of direct children
Metric.Description: Number of direct children class inherited from the class

Metric.Name: Number of hierarchies
Metric.Description: Number of hierarchy trees in the model

Metric.Name: Depth of inheritance
Metric.Description: The DIT value for a class within a generalization hierarchy is the length of the longest path from the class to the root of the hierarchy

Metric.Name: Depth of inheritance
Metric.Description: The maximum between the DIT value obtained for each class of the class diagram

Metric.Name: Specialization index
Metric.Description: Specialization index

Metric.Name: Number of methods inherited
Metric.Description: The Number of Methods Inherited metric is the total number of method inherited by a subclass.

Metric.Name: Number of methods overridden
Metric.Description: The metric counts the total number of methods overridden by a subclass.

Metric.Name: Attribute inheritance factor
Metric.Description: The Attribute Inheritance Factor is defined as a quotient between the sum of inherited attributes in all classes of the system under consideration and the total number of available attributes (locally defined plus inherited) for all classes.

Metric.Name: Method inheritance factor
Metric.Description: The Method Inheritance Factor is defined as a quotient between the sum of inherited methods in all classes of the system under consideration and the total number of available methods (locally defined and include those inherited) for all classes.

Metric.Name: Polymorphism factor
Metric.Description: The Polymorphism Factor is defined as the quotient between the actual number of different possible polymorphic situations, and the maximum number of possible distinct polymorphic situations for class Ci

Metric.Name: Abstractness
Metric.Description: Ratio of number of abstract classes and Interfaces in a Package and total number of classes.

Metric.Name: Coupling between object
Metric.Description: The Coupling Between Object classes metric represents the number of classes coupled to a given class. This metric can only be approximately measured by caculating number of classes coupled to the class through association, class attribute, operation paramater, operation return type. This metric can be considered as efferent coupling (Ce) metric.

Metric.Name: Number of attributes that have another class as their type
Metric.Description: Number of attributes that have another class as their type.

Metric.Name: Number of different classes that are used as types of attributes.
Metric.Description: The number of different classes that are used as types of attributes in a class.

Metric.Name: Number of associations
Metric.Description: The number of associations that the class involves.

Metric.Name: Direct class coupling
Metric.Description: The Direct Class Coupling metric is a count of the different number of classes that a class is directly related to. The metric includes classes that are directly related by attribute declarations and message passing (parameters) in methods

Metric.Name: Number of all ancestors
Metric.Description: The number of all ancestors of the class. It measures number of classes that this class inherits from.

Metric.Name: Number of all descendants
Metric.Description: The number of all descendants of the class. It measures number of classes inherited from this class.

Metric.Name: Number of hierarchies
Metric.Description: The number of hierarchies (inheritance trees) from this class to the root classes

Metric.Name: Number of non-redefined inherited attributes
Metric.Description: It is the number of attributes the this class inherits from all ancestor classes (not include the redefined ones).
